Sentencas: A simulation tool for modeling planar solid oxide fuel cells is demonstrated.
Titulo: Three-dimensional thermo-fluid electrochemical modeling of planar SOFC stacks

Sentencas: The tool combines the versatility of a commercial computational fluid dynamics simulation code with a validated electrochemistry calculation method.
Titulo: Three-dimensional thermo-fluid electrochemical modeling of planar SOFC stacks

Sentencas: Its function is to predict the flow and distribution of anode and cathode gases, temperature and current distributions, and fuel utilization.
Titulo: Three-dimensional thermo-fluid electrochemical modeling of planar SOFC stacks

Sentencas: A three-dimensional model geometry, including internal manifolds, was created to simulate a generic, cross-flow stack design.
Titulo: Three-dimensional thermo-fluid electrochemical modeling of planar SOFC stacks

Sentencas: Similar three-dimensional geometries were created for simulation of co-flow, and counterflow stack designs.
Titulo: Three-dimensional thermo-fluid electrochemical modeling of planar SOFC stacks

Sentencas: Cyclic boundary conditions were imposed at the top and bottom of the model domains, while the lateral walls were assumed adiabatic.
Titulo: Three-dimensional thermo-fluid electrochemical modeling of planar SOFC stacks

Sentencas: The three cases show that, for a given average cell temperature, similar fuel utilizations can result irrespective of the flow configuration.
Titulo: Three-dimensional thermo-fluid electrochemical modeling of planar SOFC stacks

Sentencas: Temperature distributions however, which largely determine thermal, stresses during operation, are dependent on the chosen design geometry/flow configuration.
Titulo: Three-dimensional thermo-fluid electrochemical modeling of planar SOFC stacks

Sentencas: The co-flow case had the most uniform temperature distribution and the smallest thermal gradients, thus offers thermo-structural advantages over the other flow cases.
Titulo: Three-dimensional thermo-fluid electrochemical modeling of planar SOFC stacks
